Here Is What We Know About The Brutal Murder Of Hindu Samaj Party Leader Kamlesh Tiwari So Far

Here Is What We Know About The Brutal Murder Of Hindu Samaj Party Leader Kamlesh Tiwari So Far

Three people have been arrested and two others have been detained for questioning in connection with the ongoing investigation into the murder of Kamlesh Tiwari, the leader of a little known political outfit Hindu Samaj Party.

The three men arrested by the Gujarat Police from Surat identified as Maulana Sheikh Salim, Faizan, and Rashad Pathan, all in their early 20s are said to be the brains behind the murder.

Uttar Pradesh Police have taken into custody two men, Mohammed Mufti Naeem Kazmi and Imam Maulana Anwarul Haq for the murder of Tiwari.

What happened on Friday?

42-year-old Tiwari was shot dead at the Naka area of Lucknow on Friday by two unidentified men inside his house. There were also multiple stab wounds on his body.

The The executioners, one wearing a saffron kurta and the other a red one, reached Tiwari's house claiming they have come to give sweets to him for Diwali.

Who is Kamlesh Tiwari?

Kamlesh Tiwari was previously associated with the controversial right wing outfit Hindu Mahasabha and had contested the 2012 assembly election from central Lucknow, but was defeated.

Hindu Samaj Party/ Twitter

He had later found his own political outfit called Hindu Samaj Party. He was also involved in the Ayodhya dispute case in SC on behalf of his outfit.

The motive of the murder?

In 2015, Tiwari had made a controversial speech which many Muslims said was insulting Prophet Muhammad. In her complaint to the police, Tiwari's wife Kiran had stated that in 2016, the two clerics, Mohammed Mufti Naeem Kazmi and Imam Maulana Anwarul Haq had issued a reward for his head for his comments against Prophet Muhammad.

Tiwari was responding to SP leader Azam Khan who called RSS members ‘homosexuals’. He was later arrested and had spent a year in jail under the NSA until it was squashed by the Allahabad High Court in 2016.

BCCL/ FILE

“Prima facie it appears that the killing was linked to Tiwari's remark on Prophet Muhammad in 2015, but nothing has been confirmed so far. The killers were probably radicalized after Tiwari made the controversial remark against Prophet,” UP Police DGP OP Singh said.

Who are the arrested men?

Maulana Sheikh Salim worked at a saree shop in Surat while Faizan used to work at a shoe shop in the city and Rashid Ahmad was a tailor. Salim is the one who is said to have instigated the others to commit the murder.

#WATCH Surat: CCTV footage of the three accused in #KamleshTiwari murder case being picked up by the Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS). pic.twitter.com/mEyxFNk2zQ — ANI (@ANI) October 19, 2019

Rashid hatched the plan which was executed by two men who are still at large.

How were they arrested?

Faizan was spotted at the CCTV of a Surat sweet shop buying sweets. The same boxes were used by the two executioners to carry the murder weapons including a pistol and a knife.

A sweet box recovered from crime spot was a vital clue in cracking the case," the UP DGP said.

Is there any terror angle?

The UP Police have so far ruled out any terror links to the murder of Tiwari. “We are working in collaboration with the Gujarat ATS and till now no link with any terrorist organization has been established. We will look into all the details and take action,” the UP top cop said.

No terror links, but...

A little know outfit which calls itself Al-Hind Brigade on Saturday sent a WhatsApp message owning responsibility for Tiwari's murder. "We at Al-Hind Brigade claim the responsibility for killing Kamlesh Tiwari, who tried to defame Islam and Muslims. More to come," the message which also had a photograph Tiwari, said, "Kamlesh Tiwari was a nuisance and whosoever points fingers towards Islam and Muslims, will meet the same end. Al-Hind Brigade takes responsibility. Get ready to see more. The war has begun."

Further details of the outfit and its possible links with other terror groups were not immediate know.
